content: The Act is titled the "Military Readiness and Southern Sea Otter Conservation Act" and focuses on the conservation of Southern Sea Otters. The Congress finds that the United States Fish and Wildlife Service developed a relocation and management plan for southern sea otters as authorized by Public Law 99-625. The plan has been administered since August 1987. National defense-related activities at San Nicolas Island have not adversely affected southern sea otters.
